text: Robertson County is a county located in the U.S. Commonwealth of Kentucky. As of the 2020 census, the population was 2,193. Its county seat is Mount Olivet. The county was formed on February 11, 1867 and is named after George Robertson, a Kentucky Congressman from 1817 to 1821. It is Kentucky's smallest county by total area and the least populous. == References == Category:1860s establishments in Kentucky Category:1867 establishments in the United States Category:Kentucky counties
title: Robertson County, Kentucky
